comments.text: You must input the firebaseConfig keys of your project in this component setup panel

In the component's left panel, specify how the Authentication state persists when using the Firebase JS SDK. You can specify whether a signed-in user should be indefinitely persisted until explicit sign out, cleared when the window is closed, or cleared on page reload.

Local: Indicates that the state will be persisted even when the browser window is closed or the activity is destroyed in React Native. An explicit sign out is needed to clear that state. Note that Firebase Auth web sessions are single host origin and will be persisted for a single domain only.

Session: Indicates that the state will only persist in the current session or tab, and will be cleared when the tab or window in which the user authenticated is closed. Applies only to web apps.

None: Indicates that the state will only be stored in memory and will be cleared when the window or activity is refreshed.

comments.text: We output the array 'providerData' from currentUser object
'currentUser' can be reused as id in an Object  node anywhere in the project to make its properties available
Creates the firebase instance and stores it in a Noodl Variable

HEAD PAGE SETUP
In your Project settings sidebar, Custom Code section, add the below Head Code:
































Firebase SDK version 9.0.0 is compatible with current setup, no version 9+.

<script type="module">
  import { initializeApp } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/9.0.0/firebase-app.js";
  import { getAuth, setPersistence, createUserWithEmailAndPassword, signInWithEmailAndPassword, browserLocalPersistence, browserSessionPersistence, inMemoryPersistence, onAuthStateChanged, sendEmailVerification, sendPasswordResetEmail, verifyBeforeUpdateEmail, updatePassword, EmailAuthProvider, reauthenticateWithCredential, signOut } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/9.0.0/firebase-auth.js";
  import { getFirestore, collection, addDoc, doc, deleteDoc, getDocs, query, getDoc, updateDoc, setDoc } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/9.0.0/firebase-firestore.js";
  import { getStorage, ref, uploadBytes, getDownloadURL } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/9.0.0/firebase-storage.js";

  // Expose Firebase initialization and auth functions to the global scope
  window.initializeApp = initializeApp;
  window.getAuth = getAuth;
  window.setPersistence = setPersistence;
  window.createUserWithEmailAndPassword = createUserWithEmailAndPassword;
  window.signInWithEmailAndPassword = signInWithEmailAndPassword;
  window.onAuthStateChanged = onAuthStateChanged;
  window.sendEmailVerification = sendEmailVerification;
  window.sendPasswordResetEmail = sendPasswordResetEmail;
  window.verifyBeforeUpdateEmail = verifyBeforeUpdateEmail;
  window.updatePassword = updatePassword;
  window.EmailAuthProvider = EmailAuthProvider;
  window.reauthenticateWithCredential = reauthenticateWithCredential;
  window.getFirestore = getFirestore;
  window.collection = collection;
  window.addDoc = addDoc;
  window.getDoc = getDoc;
  window.doc = doc;
  window.deleteDoc = deleteDoc;
  window.getDocs = getDocs;
  window.query = query;
  window.updateDoc = updateDoc;
  window.setDoc = setDoc;
  // Expose Auth persistence constants to the global scope
  window.browserLocalPersistence = browserLocalPersistence;
  window.browserSessionPersistence = browserSessionPersistence;
  window.inMemoryPersistence = inMemoryPersistence;
  // Storage
  window.getStorage = getStorage; // Make getStorage accessible globally
  window.ref = ref;
  window.uploadBytes = uploadBytes;
  window.getDownloadURL = getDownloadURL;
</script>
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/validator/validator.min.js"></script>
<script>
  window.validator = validator;
</script>
TO DO: Set the user data in firebase document

⚠️ The sendPasswordResetEmail function does not provide a success response only when the user exists; it's designed to return a "success" response even if the email is not associated with any user, to prevent enumeration attacks where an attacker could use this function to discover valid email addresses. Firebase's behavior is to silently fail, meaning it does not disclose whether an email is linked to an existing account or not, for privacy and security reasons.

dynamicports.name: inputMappingScript

parameters.functionScript:
if(!Inputs.Options) return // No options, no fun

Component.Object.Checkboxes = Inputs.Options.map((o,idx) => Noodl.Object.create({
    id:Component.Object.id+'-'+o,
    Value:o,
    Label:Inputs.Labels!==undefined?Inputs.Labels[idx]:o,
    Checked:Inputs.Selection!==undefined && Inputs.Selection.indexOf(o) !== -1
}))

Component.Object.Selection = Component.Object.Checkboxes.filter(o => o.Checked).map(o => o.Value)
Outputs.Changed()

<script type="module">
  import { initializeApp } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/9.0.0/firebase-app.js";
  import { getAuth, setPersistence, createUserWithEmailAndPassword, signInWithEmailAndPassword, browserLocalPersistence, browserSessionPersistence, inMemoryPersistence, onAuthStateChanged, sendEmailVerification, sendPasswordResetEmail, verifyBeforeUpdateEmail, updatePassword, EmailAuthProvider, reauthenticateWithCredential, signOut } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/9.0.0/firebase-auth.js";
  import { getFirestore, collection, addDoc, doc, deleteDoc, getDocs, query, getDoc, updateDoc, setDoc } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/9.0.0/firebase-firestore.js";
  import { getStorage, ref, uploadBytes, getDownloadURL } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/9.0.0/firebase-storage.js";

  // Expose Firebase initialization and auth functions to the global scope
  window.initializeApp = initializeApp;
  window.getAuth = getAuth;
  window.setPersistence = setPersistence;
  window.createUserWithEmailAndPassword = createUserWithEmailAndPassword;
  window.signInWithEmailAndPassword = signInWithEmailAndPassword;
  window.onAuthStateChanged = onAuthStateChanged;
  window.sendEmailVerification = sendEmailVerification;
  window.sendPasswordResetEmail = sendPasswordResetEmail;
  window.verifyBeforeUpdateEmail = verifyBeforeUpdateEmail;
  window.updatePassword = updatePassword;
  window.EmailAuthProvider = EmailAuthProvider;
  window.reauthenticateWithCredential = reauthenticateWithCredential;
  window.getFirestore = getFirestore;
  window.collection = collection;
  window.addDoc = addDoc;
  window.getDoc = getDoc;
  window.doc = doc;
  window.deleteDoc = deleteDoc;
  window.getDocs = getDocs;
  window.query = query;
  window.updateDoc = updateDoc;
  window.setDoc = setDoc;
  // Expose Auth persistence constants to the global scope
  window.browserLocalPersistence = browserLocalPersistence;
  window.browserSessionPersistence = browserSessionPersistence;
  window.inMemoryPersistence = inMemoryPersistence;
  // Storage
  window.getStorage = getStorage; // Make storage accessible globally
  window.ref = ref;
  window.uploadBytes = uploadBytes;
  window.getDownloadURL = getDownloadURL;
</script>
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/validator/validator.min.js"></script>
